titles: The worlds wonder. Or, a strange and miraculous work of Gods providence, shewed to a poor distressed widdow and her seven small fatherlesse children, who lived by a burnt six penny-loaf of bread, and a little water, for above seven weeks, in the wilde of Kent. To the tune of, Chevy Chase.
notes: Date of publication taken from Wing (2nd ed.)
Reproduction of original in: University of Glasgow. Library.
keywords: Providence and government of God --  Poetry.
